responsibilities: Contribute to the implementation of computer vision algorithms for aerial object detection and tracking.
Conduct research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in computer vision and machine learning.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, hardware engineers, and data scientists.
Optimize and enhance existing algorithms for improved accuracy, efficiency, and real-time performance.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to improve detection and tracking accuracy.
Help ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements in all developed solutions.
qualifications: Strong programming skills in Python and C++.
Familiarity with relevant libraries such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
In-depth knowledge of image processing, feature extraction, object detection, and tracking algorithms.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and innovate.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills focus primarily on computer vision, specifically for aerial object detection and tracking. The responsibilities include implementing computer vision algorithms, conducting research in computer vision and machine learning, and optimizing algorithms for accuracy and performance. The skills required include programming in Python and C++, familiarity with libraries like OpenCV, TensorFlow, and PyTorch, and knowledge of image processing and object detection algorithms.

There is no mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on computer vision and related technologies, which are distinct from GenAI and LLMs. GenAI typically involves creating new content or data, such as text, images, or music, while LLMs are used for understanding and generating human language. This job does not involve these aspects.
